sense.name: bestow a particular quality
sense.examples: Vases of flowers all around the room lent the place a cheerful look. These events lend support to the view that the law is inadequate. Her presence lends a certain cachet to the company.

sense.name: give something temporarily expecting it to be returned
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1 LEND NP2[patient] (PP{to NP}) NP1 LEND (NP3) NP2[patient]
sense.examples: She never lends her books. The bank refuses to lend to students. If you need a coat I can lend you one. The bank agreed to lend him $5000.

sense.name: be suitable for a particular purpose or occasion
sense.examples: This theory lends (itself) well to our new data. This story would lend (itself) well to serialization on television. The current system lends (itself) to great abuse.

sense.name: give aid or assistance
sense.examples: Students lend a hand to help end cancer. Can any pyChart experts lend a hand? Thanks to all that lent a hand.
